intro: Trechonaetes lanigera, commonly known as the woolly trechonaetes, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, woolly appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
